display: Analyse. Add an sbt-plugin, outdated. Check if you can see why scala-steward doesn't run on push. Fix it.
Check the readme. Check the scala-steward and renovate config files. Explain these.
Add a comparison and evaluation of the two different configuration approaches.
has everything been pushed to the repo?
don'd add just everything.
those three
Check for new merge requests.
we also have internal libs, like ista-common. They are in our inhouse-artifact-manager. How do I configure checks for these?
to find the precise URLs and project coordinates, please check ~/git/rdm/sbt/base-settings
So, I need to add the CI/CD Varialbe? How does Scala Steward access the registry? Is the registry token really needed?
Check my local branch in the UI project. It looks like the field lastConsumptionDateFrom and lastConsumptionDateTo are not used anymore. Is that correct?
In core-extapi, create a branch with the same name as this one. Remove those fields there, run sbt publishLocal
what is the base url for our registry?
print the repository config of the base-settings plugin
Look at the current branch of the UI project. Are core-extapi and core on the same branch?
Look at the current branch of the UI project. Are core-extapi and core on a branch with the same name?
any local changes in core-extapi

ui is driving the changes in core  and core-extapi. All three projects need to be on the same branch. The now unused fields should be removed in core-extapi. AFAIK, core-extapi is included as a dependency in core and ui. Therefore, we'll need a new version of core-extapi and update the version number in core and ui. Then UI and core should still compile
first, pull the three repos and check if there are changes on main. if so, rebase the current branch on top of latest origin/main
the 3744 branch in core should be deleted because the corresponding merge request has been merged
also the remote branch
in core, create a commit for the four changed files, and push it
check the jira issue. create merge requests for core and core-extapi with glab cli. Keep messages, titles and descriptions brief. A link to the jira issue is actually sufficient
did you push the changes in core-extapi?
I published the core-extapi snapshot. did you upgrade the dependencies in ui and core?
commit, push
ui doesn't compile
read the comments in the core-extapi merge request
does ui still compile
and is everything pushed?
check the gitlab pipelines.
continue
in core, check the gitlab pipeline for this merge request. Something doesn't compile.
in core, run sbt compile
oom? no way
run sbt compile
Can you find out if there is an easy fix?
Set it to None
run sbt compile
Is it possible that the change in ExtendedMeterPortDataRepr was a mistake?
But maybe it was a mistake to remove that field in ExtendedMeterPortDataRepr
let's revert it. then run sbt publish in core-extapi. After that, update core and ui to the latest snapshot of extapi
commit and push
sbt compile
compile again
They are on the search screen/export screen in the result table, right?
not needed anymore. can be removed
we are running in tmux. you can check the sbt ui tmux window, where sbt automatically compiles on file changes.
in the future, please don't push without my explicit confirmation
which version of core-exapi do we depend on currently?
check with tmux the compilation process for ui, which is running there.
if compilation is successful now, commit and push
no attribution
check the core sbt tmux window. Fix the compile errors
Why change the ProcessorTypeName stuff? I didn't change anything related to that
But what changed to make this error appear? Because, the main branch compiles
na ... grep the whole project for ProcessorTypeName
upgrade core and ui to extapi 0.214
First, please remove the heapdump files in the core repo again. You most likely did a git add . and added those files accidentally to the repo
Create a commit for the removed files
And that CollectorReadingRgcServiceImplSyncValidationSpec can also be removed again
and pushed
confirm
remove CollectorReadingRgcServiceImplSyncValidationSpec
1 or 2. 1 is more elegant, 2 is probably more pragmatic and faster to do
confirmed
in core, origin/main contains changes. rebase. then push.
/compact
/compact
/compact
/compact
